channel.title: Anybody got any easy reading drum music sheets?
channel.description:
I mean like
[table][tr][td] Beats 1 2 3 4 ______ Hihat Hit Hit Hit Hit Bass Hit Hit Snare Hit [/table] Like that :)?

item.title: Anybody got any easy reading drum music sheets?
item.dc:creator: @apzrman apzrman
item.description:
@apzrman wrote:

[quote=“Omfgurweird, post:12, topic:69531”][quote author=apzrman link=topic=102140.msg1059699#msg1059699 date=1175093531]
Dave Haley of Amenta/Psycroptic is faster (don’t know, havn’t heard betrayed).

AmentA (listen to the double kick on this one):
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bUBKtnuRH6Q

Psycroptic (and the drumming on this one):
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cAkkWF23Wfs
[/quote]
In The Amenta, his double bass gets WAY off beat, sure he can do it fast for the first 10-15 seconds, but then they start to get more and more off beat. I also agree with Waffen, try to learn how to drum songs by hearing them and memorizing them.[/quote]
yeah, he f*cks up in that. but the studio song is in beat

Read full topic
item.source: Anybody got any easy reading drum music sheets?

item.title: Anybody got any easy reading drum music sheets?
item.dc:creator: @Omfgurweird Omfgurweird
item.description:
@Omfgurweird wrote:

[quote=“apzrman, post:11, topic:69531”]Dave Haley of Amenta/Psycroptic is faster (don’t know, havn’t heard betrayed).

AmentA (listen to the double kick on this one):
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bUBKtnuRH6Q

Psycroptic (and the drumming on this one):
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cAkkWF23Wfs[/quote]
In The Amenta, his double bass gets WAY off beat, sure he can do it fast for the first 10-15 seconds, but then they start to get more and more off beat. I also agree with Waffen, try to learn how to drum songs by hearing them and memorizing them.

item.title: Anybody got any easy reading drum music sheets?
item.dc:creator: @apzrman apzrman
item.description:
@apzrman wrote:

jensie:

Listen to Betrayed, from Avenged Sevenfold, if you can drum that… well, your good. You’ll need a double bass anyway

Dave Haley of Amenta/Psycroptic is faster (don’t know, havn’t heard betrayed).

AmentA (listen to the double kick on this one):
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bUBKtnuRH6Q

Psycroptic (and the drumming on this one):
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cAkkWF23Wfs

Read full topic

item.title: Anybody got any easy reading drum music sheets?
item.dc:creator: @jensie jensie
item.description:
@jensie wrote:

Yes, I meant the double bass part, actualy the whole song is so variating! There isn’t realy like a patern… Well I didn’t concentrate on the drum yet, and I’m not a drummer I’ll download that song you mentionned now.

Read full topic
item.source: Anybody got any easy reading drum music sheets?

item.title: Anybody got any easy reading drum music sheets?
item.dc:creator: @Waffendennis Waffendennis
item.description:
@Waffendennis wrote:

I’d advice you to get away from tabs whilst you can!

Learn from ear and feeling, drumming is all about timing, feeling and hearing!
When you start and learn your self by tabs you will get a problem later, just keep on trying it will be hard at first but you won’t regret it later.

Btw that song you said from Avenged, isn’t hard to play (the double bass part you mean right?)
I did some harder stuff, like As I Lay Dying - 94 Hours (as example).

Read full topic
